ReDiscoverData.description: The Basilica of San Bernardino is a renowned religious landmark in L'Aquila, built to enshrine the remains of Saint Bernardino of Siena following his death in the city in 1444. While the interior features a stunning wooden ceiling, the exterior is famous for its rectilinear Renaissance facade, which was designed by the architect Cola dell'Amatrice and completed in the 16th century.
